Current Group Members

Rebecca Zhang

Graduate Student

Rebecca's research focuses on characterizing the instrumental polarization of SCExAO VAMPIRES and developing new polarimetry techniques for exoplanet characterization.

Email

Connor Vancil

Graduate Student

Connor is a third year graduate student who is broadly interested in investigating exoplanets, brown dwarfs, and their atmospheres. More specifically, he thinks about how high resolution spectroscopy and polarimetry can be leveraged for atmospheric characterization. He also enjoys simulating observations of exoplanets to set limits on current and future detection possibilities.

Email GitHub

Skyler Palatnick

Graduate Student

Skyler's research focuses on high-contrast imaging and polarimetry for exoplanet detection and characterization.

Email Website ADS ORCID

Ronald Lopez

NSF Astronomy and Astrophysics Postdoctoral Fellow

Ronald is interested in astronomical instrumentation and the discovery and characterization of directly imaged exoplanets. He is currently working on the commissioning plan for the updated polarimetry mode on the upcoming GPI 2.0 instrument and developing an MKID high-resolution multi-object spectrograph testbed for exoplanet characterization. He is also passionate about taking steps towards a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment in physics and astronomy.

Email

Will Melby

Undergraduate Student

Will is a physics undergraduate interested in exoplanets and instrumentation. His research focuses on characterizing optics for a new polarimetry mode at the Keck II telescope.

Maya (Ye) Ma

Undergraduate Student

Maya is a sophomore physics and computer science dual major. She is currently working on developing metasurface for direct imaging, focusing on fabrication at the UCSB Nanofab and optimizing the design of metasurface.

Current:

Email

Yunxuan (Lucy) Jiang

Undergraduate Student

Yunxuan is a senior data science major. Her work is dedicated to the Gemini Planet Imager (GPI) data pipeline extraction, with a special focus on optimizing the efficiency and accuracy of ePSF model extraction. She is interested in data modeling and optimization within the realms of astronomy and finance.
